docs.snippet: PARIS, June 10--Overproduction of wine in France has become one of the leading topics of the French electoral campaign with the decision of the General Confederation of Winegrowers to ask Mayors in the four chief winegrowing districts to declare a...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, June 10--Overproduction of wine in France has become one of the leading topics of the French electoral campaign with the decision of the General Confederation of Winegrowers to ask Mayors in the four chief winegrowing districts to declare a strike in their administrations on June 17, Election Day.

headline.main: FRENCH VINTNERS THREATEN STRIKE; Growers Ask Mayors in Wine Districts to Declare Tie-Up on June 17, Election Day

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)-- Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan today allocated 2,500,000 bales of cotton for export during the first four months of the 1951 cotton marketing year beginning Aug. 1.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)-- Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan today allocated 2,500,000 bales of cotton for export during the first four months of the 1951 cotton marketing year beginning Aug. 1.
docs.abstract: Sec Brannan allots 214 million bales for Aug-Nov; list

headline.main: '51 ALLOCATION SET ON COTTON EXPORTS; Shipment of 2,500,000 Bales to Be Permitted in Four Months From Aug. 1

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 15--A demand on the former owners of the expropriated newspaper La Prensa for payment of 32,000,000 pesos [more than $2,000,000] as customs duty on newsprint imported...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 15--A demand on the former owners of the expropriated newspaper La Prensa for payment of 32,000,000 pesos [more than $2,000,000] as customs duty on newsprint imported...
docs.abstract: Govt demand that ex-owners of Prensa pay customs duty on '39-48 newsprint imports seen as move to avoid paying for seized Prensa properties; takes same action against Nacion; Dr Gainza Paz sees Prensa seizure temporary

headline.main: HUGE NEWSPRINT TAX DEMANDED OF PRENSA

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 15-- Democracia, chief political newspaper, charged today that the Opposition Radical, Socialist and Democratic parties "have planned again to assassinate President Juan Peron and his wife Eva Peron."
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 15-- Democracia, chief political newspaper, charged today that the Opposition Radical, Socialist and Democratic parties "have planned again to assassinate President Juan Peron and his wife Eva Peron."
docs.abstract: Buenos Aires Democracia charges Opposition plots to assassinate Perons; links Dr Gainza Paz to expelled US Aide J Griffith

headline.main: Peronists' Paper Charges Plot to Assassinate Peron
